entry.title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum: A Culture War Rooted in First Principles
entry.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum, despite acting as twin forces for accelerating and adopting cryptocurrencies and blockchain technologies, have historically been at odds with each other due to the â€œL1 warsâ€ and their vocal online proponents. To some, the rivalry may seem like a mere culture war within the crypto community. However at itsâ€™ root, it's a reflection of distinct foundational beliefs resulting in divergence. Let's delve deeper into these foundational beliefs: Bitcoin: A Beacon of Decentralization (and Liquidity) Bitcoin was designed to challenge traditional financial systems, presenting an alternative that removed the need for intermediaries. The support base resonates with this aim, and thus places decentralization as itsâ€™ primary criterion. An example of this commitment was the blocksizâ€¦

entry.title: Paypal Launches US Dollar-Denominated Stablecoin PYUSD on Venmo
entry.summary:
On Wednesday, the payment giant Paypal announced that the stablecoin PYUSD is now available on Venmo. Paypal detailed that the stablecoin asset will be available to select Venmo users and fully roll out for all users â€œin the coming weeks.â€
Paypal Stablecoin PYUSD Makes Its Way to Venmo
Paypal has disclosed that Venmo users can now leverage the firmâ€™s proprietary stablecoin, PYUSD. The rollout is starting with select Venmo users, but soon all Venmo customers will be able to â€œable to purchase PYUSD and send it to friends and family on Paypal, Venmo, and compatible external wallets.â€
The company notes that transfers between Paypal users and Venmo are â€œfast and free,â€ with the exception of blockchain network fees. PYUSD is an ERC20 token, which means the coin is subject to fees associated with the Ethereum fee market and block space.
For example, etherscan.io indicates that the cost to transfer an ERC20 token on September 20, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. (ET), ranges from $2.65 to $2.91 per transaction. Paypal further mentions in the announcement that PYUSD is now available on various platforms, including Coinbase, Crypto.com, Bitstamp, Kraken, MetaMask, Ledger, Phantom, Bitpay, and Fireblocks, among others.
The payments company also highlights its recent approval by the New York State Department of Financial Services. The latest development comes on the heels of PYUSDâ€™s first transparency report, which unveiled the backing of cash and U.S. Treasury reverse repurchase agreements as reserves.
As of September 20, approximately 44.37 million PYUSD coins are in circulation. A total of 698 distinct addresses currently hold PYUSD, with these wallets collectively executing 3,354 transfers since the currencyâ€™s launch. Additionally, the top 100 holders jointly possess 99.96% of the PYUSD supply, equivalent to 44,358,474.05 PYUSD tokens.
What do you think about PYUSD being supported by Venmo? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: Chilean Drug Trafficking Ring Was Also Mining Bitcoin: Report
Rare Video Surfaces of Bitcoin Pioneer Hal Finney Speech at Crypto Conference
entry.summary: A previously little-seen video of the late Hal Finney, a pioneering figure in the world of Bitcoin, has surfaced, shedding light on his groundbreaking work on cryptographic protocols, and giving a rare glimpse of his humanity. In the video, recorded at the Crypto 98 conference, Finney is seen discussing zero-knowledge proofs, offering a glimpse of how many of the cutting-edge concepts still being tested for Bitcoin, are in fact, decades old. "I want to prove to you that I know a message that hashes to a given hash value using the SHA-1 hash. I don't want to reveal anything about the message to you. It's a zero-knowledge proof, and I've written a program to do this that I'll tell you about," Finney says in the introduction. From there, he proceeds to outline his motivation for this projectâ€¦

Ensuring that they have a secure financial future is just one way to show appreciation for their commitment. Enter Dominick Bei, a visionary entrepreneur who has revolutionized retirement savings for union and firefighter pensions through the concept of Proof of Workforce.

entry.title: Bitcoin Exchange Supply Plunges Again, Erases Recent Increase
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin exchange supply has resumed its downtrend recently, after earlier deviating towards a rise.
Bitcoin Percent Supply On Exchanges Has Dropped To 11.8%
As pointed out by an analyst in a post on X, the BTC exchange supply is back to its year-to-date (YTD) lows. The relevant metric here is the â€œpercent balance on exchanges,â€ which keeps track of the total percentage of the Bitcoin supply thatâ€™s currently sitting in the wallets of all centralized exchanges.
When the value of this indicator goes up, it means that the investors are depositing a net amount of the cryptocurrency into these platforms. As one of the main reasons why investors make such transfers is for selling purposes, this kind of trend can carry potential bearish effects for the coin.
On the â€¦

entry.title: The Protocol: Ethereum Struggles With Sprawl as Optimism Airdrops $27M
entry.summary: Last week marked the one-year anniversary of Ethereumâ€™s historic â€œMergeâ€ â€“ the shift to a more energy-efficient proof-of-stake network. But in some ways the largest smart-contract blockchain has become a victim of its own success: Staking is so popular that the number of network validators is mushrooming toward 1 million, introducing new concerns related to the sprawl. We discuss how Ethereum developers are addressing the issue with the EIP-7514 proposal.

Allan Joseph Bankman and Barbara Fried, who are legal scholars and professors at Stanford Law School, have found themselves at the centre of this controversy. The lawsuit claims that Stanford University received gifts worth approximately $5.5 million from FTX-related entities between November 2021 and May 2022. entry.title: Introducing RFK Jr. to Bitcoinâ€™s Nashian Orientation
entry.summary: The Bitcoin-Backed Dollar in DialogueÂ In July a bitcoin-related topic was broached by Robert Kennedy Jr., which to my knowledge has not been addressed by anyone holding the top office of the executive branch or a notable candidate for the position of President. Of course, John Nashâ€™s Ideal Money is a perennial topic, one I have explored conversationally in the past. It can be a controversial and divisive position, just like other opinions RFK Jr. holds, with a few proponents endorsing even more radical thoughts than the common consensus. How metaâ€¦ But to contextualize the totality of what RFK Jr. said regarding a Bitcoin-backed dollar requires us to do a little homework. Luckily, Bitcoin Magazineâ€™s Editor-in-Chief Mark Goodwin has done a lot of the informational legwork for us in a piece â€¦

entry.title: SECâ€™s Crypto Chief Signals Ramp-Up in Enforcement: â€˜Weâ€™re Going to Continue to Bring Those Chargesâ€™
entry.summary:
According to David Hirsch, head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commissionâ€™s (SEC) Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit, more enforcement actions against firms that havenâ€™t properly registered with the regulator are expected. Hirsch discussed crypto assets and exchanges Tuesday at an SEC forum in Chicago.
SEC Crypto Head Forewarns Tougher Enforcement
While the crypto community has focused on the XRP case and lawsuits against Coinbase and Binance, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission may target more violators soon. David Hirsch, head of the SECâ€™s Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit, made the statements, as reported by Coindesk.
On Tuesday at the Securities Enforcement Forum Central in Chicago, Hirsch said the SEC will â€œcontinue to bring those charges.â€
â€œWeâ€™re going to continue to be active as to intermediaries,â€ Hirsch told the audience. â€œThat can be brokers, dealers, exchanges, clearing agencies or any others who are active in this space, are within our jurisdiction and not meeting their obligations, either through registration or failure to provide adequate or complete disclosures.â€
The SEC has cracked down on several high-profile crypto companies such as Binance, Bittrex US, and Coinbase. More recently it has been focused on a couple of non-fungible token (NFT) projects that raised millions without disclosure.
Hirsch insists more enforcement is coming. â€œWeâ€™re going to continue to conduct investigations, weâ€™re gonna be active in the space, and adding the label of [decentralized finance] is not going to be something thatâ€™s going to deter us from continuing our work,â€ the SEC official remarked.
The SEC official noted the regulator has significant ongoing litigation. Beyond enforcement actions against exchanges and brokers, the market capitalization of crypto coins that the SEC claims are crypto securities stands at $85.4 billion.
What do you think about the SECâ€™s crypto chief and his statements at the forum in Chicago? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

He emphasized that the agency is poised to bring forth new charges against various players in the crypto arena, including crypto exchanges, brokers, dealers, and others who fail to comply with proper disclosures or registration requirements. Hirschâ€™s message was clear: comâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: XRP, MATIC Move to Multi-Week Highs on Wednesday
entry.summary:
XRP was a big mover on Wednesday, despite cryptocurrency markets mostly consolidating in todayâ€™s session. Traders have moved to secure recent gains, ahead of Septemberâ€™s Federal Reserve interest rate decision. Polygon was also in the green, hitting a two-week high in the process.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, was a notable gainer in todayâ€™s session, as the token raced to a multi-week high.
Following a low of $0.5092 on Tuesday, XRP/USD raced to an intraday peak at $0.5233 earlier in the day.
As a result of the surge in price, XRP climbed to its highest point since August 31, when price peaked at $0.5285.
Looking at the chart, the move came as the relative strength index (RSI) broke free of a ceiling at 48.00.
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 50.66, with bulls possibly targeting a ceiling at 58.00.
In the event traders reach this target, there is a strong chance XRP will move above $0.5500.
Polygon (MATIC)
In addition to XRP, polygon (MATIC) also surged to a multi-week high on Wednesday, despite market uncertainty ahead of the Fed announcement.
MATIC/USD peaked at $0.5486 earlier in todayâ€™s session, after rebounding from a low of $0.536 the day before.
The move pushed polygon to its strongest level since September 8, when the token reached a high of $0.5586.
Earlier gains have since faded, and this appears to be due to the RSI failing to break out of its ceiling at the 49.00 mark.
Currently, price strength sits at 47.34, however momentum remains largely bullish, ahead of a potential moving average crossover.
The 10-day (red) and 25-day (blue) trend lines are on the cusp of an upwards cross, which could trigger a fresh price surge.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could polygon hit $0.6000 before the end of the month? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Space Nation CEO on Working With 'Independence Day' Director Roland Emmerich
entry.summary: Jerome Wu, CEO of Space Nation, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the upcoming Space Nation Online game in development and shares details on Space Nation Cofounder Roland Emmerich's role in the project.

entry.title: GAME REVIEW: Champions Arena from Gala Games
entry.summary: Champions Arena is a turn-based fantasy RPG from Gala Games, where characters can become NFTs and crypto can be used to purchase gems, one of the game's synthetic currencies. Decrypt's Kate Irwin takes us inside the game for her thoughts on the fun, mobile-first title.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor Ben Prendergast on the Future of Gaming
entry.summary: Voice actor Ben Prendergast, who's voiced characters in games like Apex Legends and God of War Ragnarok, shares his opinions on the tech space's history of "bubbles" and whether blockchain gaming has a future.

entry.title: The Future of AI Stardom and Robotics With SingularityNET COO Janet Adams and Desdemona
entry.summary: In this interview, SingularityNET COO Janet Adams explains the intricate details that went into creating the Desdemona robot AI from Hanson Robotics and future plans for the AI Diva.

entry.title: Crypto a 'No-Brainer' for Video Games, Says Mino Games CEO
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.
